PostUserActivitiesBody.description:
**Below is the detail of each field for Body API Capacity Constraint**


| Field | Description | Required |
 |---|---|---|
 | startDate | Filter date from for find data 
**Example:** `2022-11-01`.| true |
 | endDate | Filter date until for find data 
**Example:** `2022-11-10`.| true |
 | hubId | The identifier for the hub that generated by system. Use GET /hubs API to get the list of Hub IDs.| true |
 | flows | Array of flow's name.| false |
 | flowIds | Array of flow Id's.| false |

**Example:** `Jack Ward`

startTime.description:
Start time refers to the designated time for users to begin a task. If `startTime` is not provided, it will default to the configured time in the flow. You can view the datetime format here.
**Example:** `2022-11-02T07:28:23+00:00`

endTime.description:
End time is the deadline for completing a task. If `endTime` is not specified, it will default to the configured time in the flow.The task cannot be completed if the date has passed the `endtime`. You can view the datetime format here
**Example:** `2022-11-05T07:28:23+00:00`

assignee.description:
You can assign tasks using user email according to their task hub.  To assign tasks to multiple users, use a comma (',') as a separator.
**Example:** `['leandro@mile.app']`

background.description:
When the background parameter is set to `true` , the action will be processed in the background. In this mode, the API call will return quickly with a response indicating that the create task request has been received and is being processed asynchronously in the background. When the background parameter is set to `false` (default), the create task will be processed directly via API. This means that the API call will wait for the create task process to complete before returning the results to the user. 
 **Default:** `false`.

postExportTask.title: postExportTask
postExportTask.description: Request body schema for exporting tasks. Use filters to narrow down the dataset and customize the export output.

download.description:
File type that user want to download. There are 2 types of `download`:
**enum**: `json`,`xlsx`
**Example:** `xlsx`

fields.description:
Fields is for selecting the specific fields that you can choose by multiples to show in the response using a string with a comma delimiter.
**Example:** `startTime,endTime,hubId,createdBy,flow,status`

doneBy.description:
Name of user that completing the task.
**Example:** `Leandro`

assignee.description:
User email for a given task.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

status.description:
Status of task according to task's data condition. There are 3 types of `status`:
**enum**: `UNASSIGNED`,`ONGOING`,`DONE`
**Example:** `UNASSIGNED`

flowId.description:
The identifier for the flow that generated by system. Use [GET /flows API](#tag/Flow/operation/getflow) to get the list of flow id.
Comma (,) delimiter for filter multiple flow.
**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86,73d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd87`

hubId.description:
The identifier for the hub that generated by system. Use [GET /hubs API](#tag/Hub/operation/getHubs) to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

sortBy.description:
sortBy is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order according to selected field. The value of this param is one of available fields on task objects.
**Example:** `flow`, `assignee`, `status`, `hubId`, etc.
**Default:** `createdTime`

sortOrder.description:
sortOrder is to decide ascending or descending order
**Example:** `asc` or `desc`.
**Default:** `desc`

background.description:
If the user sets the background parameter to `true`, the export process will utilize background processing, and the results will be available at [GET /tasks/export-log API](#tag/Export-Task/operation/GetExportLog). If the user sets the background parameter to `false`, the export process will run directly, and the results will be immediately available in the response.
**Example:** `true`.
**Default:** `false`

exportConfigId.description:
Unique identifier for the export config for allow user to export data using their own configuration. Use [GET /export-configs](#tag/Export-Config/operation/getExportConfigs) endpoint to get the list of Export Config IDs.
**Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

**Example:** `daily`

Specified unit of time for the scheduling interval. Determines how often the scheduled task will run based on the interval value.This required when select the custom periode.
**Example:** `daily`

schedules.description:
Object with format according to value of periode. Configuration for the time of task scheduler will run.
**Example for periode of** `daily`:
`[{`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `weekly`:
`[{`
`'day':'sunday',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `monthly`:
`[{`
`'date':'1',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`
**Example for periode of** `byDate`:
`[{`
`'date':'2022-11-03',`
`'time':['07:00']`
`}]`

day.description:
Name of day in a week. `day` is required when *periode* value is `weekly`.
**Example:** `sunday`

time.description:
Time of the task schedule will be executed.
**Example:** `07:00`

date.description:
Date of task schedule will be executed. `date` is required when *periode* value is `monthly` or `byDate`.
**Example for monthly periode**: `1`
**Example for byDate periode**: `2022-11-03`

hubId.description:
The identifier for the hub that generated by system. Use [GET /hubs API](#Setting_Hub) to get the list of Hub IDs.
**Example:** `621dd813eb3ebf16b94d6969`

name.description:
The name of the vehicle, which can be a number plate, vehicle brand, or any relevant identifier for the vehicle. This name is used to distinguish and label each vehicle in the route optimization results.
**Example**: `Mini Van 54`

assignee.description:
Worker's email that is assigned to the vehicle. Each vehicle can only be assigned to one worker, and this parameter helps to manage the vehicle assignments.
**Example**: `leandro@mile.app`

workingTime.description:
Working hours of the vehicle, containing **startTime**, **endTime**, and **multiday**. The time is specified in the 24-hour format, and it defines the time span during which the vehicle is available for routing tasks. In this example, the multiday value is set to 1, indicating that the vehicle's working hours span two consecutive calendar days. The vehicle starts its shift at 9:00 AM and continues until 4:00 PM the next day. 
**Example**:
`{`
`'startTime':'08:00',`
`'endTime':'17:00',`
`'multiday':0`
`}`

startTime.description:
Time of departure of the vehicle from the hub.
**Example:** `08:00`

endTime.description:
Maximum working time of vehicle to operate.
**Example:** `17:00`

multiday.description:
Additional working days accumulatedbased on the number of days.
**Example**: `0`
Implementation of **multiday** is used to add **endTime** value,
which means **endTime** = **endTime** + (24 hours * **multiday**)

breakTime.description: Indicates that the data inside represents the break time for the vehicle. containing: **startTime**, and **endTime**.

startTime.description:
The starting time of the break.
**Example:** `08:00`

endTime.description:
The ending time of the break.
**Example:** `17:00`

speed.description:
The average speed of the vehicle in kilometers per hour (km/h). Must not be less than 5 km/h.
**Example**: `30`
**Default**: `25`

fixedCost.description:
The Cost Factor value range is set from 0 to 100, with the default value being 0. A lower number signifies a higher priority for routing optimization purposes. 
**Example:** `15`
**Default:** `0`

tags.description:
Tags used for route optimization purposes. Visits with matching tags will be assigned to vehicles with the same tags.
**Example**: `['Ganjil','Depok','B1124CC']`

capacity.description:
Capacity specifications for route optimization, which are dynamic based on user needs. Includes minimum and maximum values for weight and volume.
**Example**:
`{`
`'weight':{'min':10,'max':1000},`
`'volume':{'min':10,'max':1000}`
`}`

{constraint-n}.description:
Key of capacity constraints, each with a minimum and maximum value. 
**Example**:  `{'min':10,'max':1000}`

min.description:
Minimum value of capacity constraint. Less than .max
**Example:** `10`

max.description:
Maximum value of capacity constraint. Greater than .min
**Example:** `1000`

_id.description: A unique identifier of this routing result.

configuration.description: An object containing various configuration settings for the route optimization.

name.description: A string representing the name of this configuration.

autoSpeed.description: A boolean value set to **false**, mean that the vehicle speed is not automatically determined.

defaultSpeed.description: An integer representing the default speed of vehicles.

defaultVisitTime.description: An integer representing the default time for each visit

clustering.description: A boolean value set to false, mean that clustering is not enabled

multitrip.description: A boolean value set to **true**, mean that it allows for multiple trips.

useAllVehicle.description: A boolean value set to **true**, mean that all available vehicles are used.

returnToBase.description: A boolean value set to **true**, mean that vehicles return to their base after completing visits.

capacityConstraint.description: An array containing capacity constraint names.

useOddEven.description: A boolean value indicating whether odd-even license plate restrictions should be enforced during route optimization. When set to true, vehicles will only be routed during time periods that match their odd/even classification.

oddEvenTime.description: An array of time windows during which odd-even restrictions are enforced. Each object contains startTime and endTime defining the restricted periods.

startTime.description: Start time of the odd-even restriction period.

endTime.description: End time of the odd-even restriction period.

name.description: A string representing the name of this route optimization.

routingDate.description: The date for which the route optimization is performed.

resultCode.description: Unique values for result optimization data as an alternative identifier.

result.description: The result key contains success and failed optimized visits list

routing.description: An array containing details of the routes.

volumePercentage.description: The volume percentage for this route.

totalDistance.description: The total distance covered by this route.

totalVolume.description: The total volume carried by this route.

vehicleMaxWeight.description: The maximum weight capacity of the vehicle.

fixedCost.description: The cost factor for this route.

workingTime.description: The time window during which this vehicle can work.

startTime.description: Minimum working time of vehicle to operate.

endTime.description: Maximum working time of vehicle to operate.

vehicleMaxVolume.description: The maximum volume capacity of the vehicle.

speed.description: The speed of the vehicle.

vehicleId.description: The unique identifier for the vehicle.

totalNodes.description: The total number of nodes (locations) visited in this route.

finishTime.description: The time when this route finished.

totalVisits.description: The total number of visits made in this route.

totalTrips.description: The total number of trips made by the vehicle in this route.

vehicleMinVolume.description: The minimum volume capacity of the vehicle.

totalWeight.description: The total weight carried by this vehicle in this route.

trips.description: An array containing details of individual trips in this route. Each trip represents a visit or stop during the route.

isHub.description: A boolean value indicating whether the dropped visit was a hub (starting/ending point).

weight.description: The weight value seems to be 0, suggesting that there is no specific weight associated with this visit or hub in this context.

visitId.description: The visitId is likely a unique identifier for this visit or hub. It can be used to distinguish different visits or locations within the system.

waitingTime.description: The waitingTime indicates the time, in some unit (e.g., minutes), that one needs to wait at this hub or location before proceeding to the next destination or performing the next action.

eta.description: ETA stands for Estimated Time of Arrival.

volume.description: The volume value seems to be 0, indicating that there is no specific volume associated with this visit or hub in this context. Volume could refer to the quantity of items or goods associated with this location.

order.description: The order value also seems to be 0, suggesting that there is no specific order associated with this visit or hub. In the context of logistics or transportation, an order could refer to a sequence number of stops on a delivery route.

coordinate.description: This represents the geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the hub or location, placing it at approximately -6.17549 latitude and 106.79073 longitude.

etd.description: ETD stands for Estimated Time of Departure. It indicates the estimated time when the visit or vehicle is expected to depart from this hub or location.

visitTime.description: The visitTime appears to be set to 0, indicating that there is no specific visit time associated with this hub or visit in this context. Visit time typically refers to the time taken at a particular location for loading, unloading, or other actions.

travelTime.description: The travelTime is also set to 0, suggesting that there is no specific travel time associated with this visit or hub. Travel time usually refers to the time taken to travel from one location to another.

distance.description: Distance usually refers to the spatial separation between the locations

allowOddEven.description: A boolean value indicating whether odd-even restrictions allow this trip to be made. When true, the trip timing complies with the vehicle's odd-even classification and restriction windows.

vehicleMinWeight.description: The minimum weight capacity of the vehicle

assignee.description: The user of the assigned for this route.

totalTravelTime.description: The total travel time for this route.

isOddEven.description: A boolean value indicating whether this route is affected by odd-even license plate restrictions. When true, the vehicle's routing has been optimized considering odd-even time windows.

oddEven.description: The odd-even category of the vehicle used in this route. Shows whether the vehicle has 'odd' or 'even' numbered license plate.

dropped.description: An array of dropped visit details.

isHub.description: A boolean value indicating whether the dropped visit was a hub (starting/ending point).

tags.description: Tags associated with the dropped visit.

coordinate.description: The coordinates (latitude and longitude) of the dropped visit.

capacity.description: An object representing the capacity constraints for the dropped visit.

timeWindow.description: The time window during which the visit was scheduled. Note: This field is not considered when timeWindows is provided.

startTime.description: Minimum visit available time.

endTime.description: Maximum visit available time

timeWindows.description: Array of time windows during which the visit was scheduled. When this field is provided, the timeWindow field will be ignored.

startTime.description: Minimum visit available time.

endTime.description: Maximum visit available time

visitTime.description: The visit time (duration of stay) for this dropped visit.

id.description: The unique identifier for this visit.

name.description: The name of the dropped visit.

address.description: The address associated with the dropped.

reason.description: The reason for dropping this visit.

summary.description: An object containing summary information for this route optimization:

totalDistance.description: An integer representing the total distance covered in all routes.

droppedVisits.description: An integer representing the number of dropped visits in all routes.

totalVisits.description: An integer representing the total number of visits in all routes.

totalVehicles.description: An integer representing the total number of vehicles used in all routes.

maxFinishTime.description: A string representing the maximum finish time among all routes.

usedVehicles.description: An integer representing the number of vehicles used in all routes.

totalVisitTime.description: An integer representing the total time spent on visits in all routes.

avgSpeed.description: An integer representing the average speed of vehicles in all routes.

totalWaitingTime.description: An integer representing the total waiting time in all routes.

minFinishTime.description: A string representing the minimum finish time among all routes.

routedVisits.description: An integer representing the number of visits that were routed in all routes.

avgFinishTime.description: A string representing the average finish time among all routes.

unusedVehicles.description: An integer representing the number of unused vehicles in all routes.

totalTravelTime.description: An integer representing the total travel time in all routes.

capacityConstraint.description: An array containing capacity constraint details for weight and volume.

totalSpentTime.description: An integer representing the total time spent in all routes.

status.description:
A string indicating the status of the route optimization. There will only 3 type of status : **ongoing**, **done**, and **failed**. 
 **ongoing** mean that routing executed in background and still on progress. 
 **done** mean that route optimize has successfully executed and finish the process. 
  **failed** mean that route optimize executed but failed cause of something wrong that you can see the reason at the message field.

message.description: A string that will only exists when routing process has **failed** and giving the reason of it.

hubCoordinate.description: A string representing the latitude and longitude of the hub.

hubId.description: A unique identifier representing the hub associated with this route optimization.

organizationId.description: A unique identifier representing the organization ID associated with this route optimization.

countryCode.description: A string representing the country code.

user.description: An object containing user-related who create this route information.

createdBy.description: A user ID, representing the user who created this routing.

createdFrom.description: A string indicating the source from which the route optimization was created.

finishTime.description: A timestamp representing the date and time when the routing process finish. To measure the distance between processes can be done based on **createdTime** and **finishTime**.

createdTime.description: A timestamp representing the date and time when this route optimization was created.

updatedTime.description: A timestamp representing the date and time when this data was last updated.

Component values will be displayed in other components.Field only exist, if *component* is **view** or **bill** or **list** 
**Example:** `$name`

routeAs.description:
Flag Trigger of routing data.There are 8 types of `routeAs`:
`VisitName`,`Address`,`OpenTime`,`CloseTime`,`VisitDuration`,`Coordinate`,`Tag`,`Constraint.weight` 
**Example:** `VisitName`

showAs.description:
Flag Trigger of Component title. There are 3 types of `showAs`:
`title`,`content`,`label` 
**Example:** `label`

isRequired.description:
Flag that mark field as required or not on flow component. 
**Example:** `true`

visible.description:
Flag on flow component that will make task field visible or not. 
**Example:** `true`

useUnit.description:
To set input type number using unit. Field only exist, if *component* is **number** 
**Example:** `true`

units.description:
Value of units for input type number component. Field only exist, if *component* is **number** 
**Example:** `['KG', 'G', 'M3', 'cbM']`

useGeoLock.description:
Flag Trigger of geolock feature on mobile devices. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `true`

radius.description:
Distance in units (m) to use geolock. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate**
**Example:** `2000`

geoLockTrigger.description:
Trigger to determine when the geolock will be used. There are 2 types of `geoLockTrigger`:
`onTaskDone`,`onTaskStart`. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `onTaskDone`

useGeocode.description:
To set coordinate use geocode. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `true`

geocodeAs.description:
To reference geocode use the address component id. Field only exist, if *component* is **coordinate** 
**Example:** `address`

onSelect.description: Detailed object data of the selected event. Field only exist, if *component* is **select**

options.description:
Option on select component that when it is selected will trigger an action. 
**Example:** `['success']`

action.description:
Desired action if that option is selected. There are 3 types of `action`:
`show`,`hide`,`fill`
**Example:** `show`

componentAffected.description:
Components that will be affected by the selected action. There are 7 types of `componentAffected`:
 `text`, `date`, `dateTime`, `time`, `number`, `address`, `coordinate`. 
**Example:** `['text']`

min.description:
Min value of component. Field only exist, if *component* is **select** or **photo** 
**Example:** `0`

max.description:
Max value of component. Field only exist, if *component* is **select** or **photo** 
**Example:** `3`

categories.description:
Value of category for photo component. Field only exist, if *component* is **photo** 
**Example:** `['Living Room','Kitchen']`

watermark.description:
Configuration for users to enable watermark on photos when creating tasks. The default value of the watermark is `false`. Field only exist, if *component* is **photo** 
**Example:** `true`

addNew.description:
Configuration to allow users to add new items to the task bill or task list. Field only exist, if *component* is **bill** or **list** 
**Example:** `true`

addNewType.description:
Way to add a new list. There are 2 types of `addNewType`:
`input`,`select`. Field only exist, if *component* is **list**.  
**Example:** `select`

addNewData.description:
Detailed list of item names. Field only exist, if *component* is **list** and *addNewType* is **select** 
**Example:** `['Snack','Drink']`

addNewValidationType.description:
Configuration to set the data type validation used. There are 5 types of `addNewValidationType`:
`noValidation`,`text`,`number`,`textAndNumber`,`custom`. Field only exist, if *component* is **list** and *addNewType* is **input**. 
**Example:** `text`

addNewValidation.description:
Regex validation details following `addNewValidationType`. Field only exist, if *component* is **list** and *addNewType* is **input**. 
 **Example:** `^[a-zA-Z\s]+$`

masterItems.description: Detail data object of the master items contain `name` and`unit_price`. Field only exist, if *component* is **bill**

name.description:
Name of the bill item. 
**Example:** `Snack`

masterCosts.description: Detail data object of the master costs contain `type`,`name` and `amount`. Field only exist, if *component* is **bill**

name.description:
Name of bill cost. 
**Example:** `Cost`

inputType.description: The input type of the component (e.g., string, number, date, etc.)

costs.description:
Cost data available on the billing component. Field only exist, if *component* is **bill** 
**Example:** `['Cost']`

useDataSource.description:
Configuration to use the data source as a item in the selected component. Field only exist, if *component* is **list** or **bill** 
**Example:** `false`

autoStart.description:
Configuration to initiate the time when users open a task on a mobile device. Field only exist, if *component* is **timer** 
**Example:** `false`

reset.description:
Configuration to enable the reset function of the timer on mobile device. Field only exist, if *component* is **timer** 
**Example:** `false`

unpausable.description:
Configuration to remove the pause timer function on mobile device. Field only exist, if *component* is **timer** 
**Example:** `false`

maxDuration.description:
The maximum time configuration for using the voice component ranges from 0 to 10 minutes. Field only exist, if *component* is **voice** 
**Example:** `5`

configurations.description:
Settings configuration for advance setting of the flow. 
 **Example:** 
 `{` 
  `'id': 'startTime',` 
  `'adjustment': 0` 
`},` 
`{` 
  `'id': 'endTime',` 
  `'adjustment': 24` 
`}`

id.description:
ID of configuration. 
**Example:** `startTime`

orderIndex.description:
Order of flow. User can define it by number value.
**Example:** `1`

name.description:
The name used in the flow display must be unique to avoid any conflicts or confusion. Cannot use the flow name ``Activity`` as it is already in use by the system.
**Example:** `Delivery`

pages.description:
Settings that will define the detail information of flow structure. 
 **Example:** 
 `{` 
 `'id': 'page0',` 
 `'components': [`  
`{` 
`'component': 'input',` 
`'id': 'title',` 
`'type': 'string',` 
`'default': null,` 
`'title': 'Title',` 
`'required': 'true',`
`'visible': 'true',`
`'showAs': 'title'` 
`}` 
`]` 
`}`

ID of page. 
 **Example:** `page0`

components.description:
Detail of Component. 
 **Example:** 

                `{` 

                `'component': 'input',` 

                `'id': 'title',` 

                `'type': 'string',` 

                `'default': null,` 

                `'title': 'Title',` 

                `'required': true,` 

                `'visible': true,` 

                `'showAs': 'title'` 

                `}`

flow.description: Detail of object flows.

example.name: Customer Survey
example.prompt: Create a customer satisfaction survey flow with fields for rating (1-5 stars), feedback text, contact preference (email or phone), and optional follow-up date. Include a thank you message at the end.

name.description:
The unique name for the flow. Must be unique within the organization and cannot use reserved names: `Activity`, `Handover`, `ActivityWorkflow`. Only alphanumeric characters, spaces, hyphens, and underscores are allowed.
**Example:** `Customer Survey`

prompt.description:
Natural language description of the desired flow structure. The AI will generate pages, components, and configurations based on this prompt. Minimum 20 characters, maximum 1200 characters.
**Example:** `Create a customer satisfaction survey flow with fields for rating (1-5 stars), feedback text, contact preference (email or phone), and optional follow-up date. Include a thank you message at the end.`

status.description: Status of response. Always `true` for successful validation.

message.description: Success message indicating the flow structure was validated successfully.

data.description: Validated flow structure ready to be used for flow creation.

name.description: The validated flow name.

pages.description: Array of validated page objects containing components.

configurations.description: Array of validated configuration objects for the flow.

duplicate_name.message: The name has already been taken.

name: The name has already been taken.

ai_error.message: Failed to generate flow structure from the provided prompt.

invalid_prompt.message: The prompt provided is not suitable for flow generation.

status.description: Status of response. Always `false` for errors.

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong.

failedCode.description:
Standardized error code. Possible values:
- `flow-001`: Required field missing
- `flow-002`: Unique constraint violation (duplicate name)
- `flow-013`: Invalid configuration or AI generation error
- `flow-045`: Server error

errors.description: Detailed validation errors array (present for validation failures). Contains string of flow field error messages.

invalid_prompt.description: Boolean flag indicating the prompt was not suitable for flow generation (present only when AI determines prompt is invalid).

id.description: Unique identifier for the data that generated by system. **Example:** `['EyyyuZABO6Fu1BKE6hZB']`

name.description:
Automation's name.
**Example:** `Auto create task automation`

event.description:
Act as a trigger that start an automation. There are 8 different types. 
 *enum: onTaskCreated, onTaskFinished, onTaskAssigned, onDataSourceCreated, onRoutingResultFinished, onRoutingResultDispatched, onStartTrip, onFinishTrip* 
 **onTaskCreated**: Automation will happen when a task is created. 
 **onTaskFinished**: Automation will happen when a task is finished (status task: Done). 
 **onTaskAssigned**: Automation will happen when a task is assigned to field user(s). 
 **onDataSourceCreated**: Automation will happen when a data source is created. 
 **onRoutingResultFinished**: Automation will happen when a routing created is created. 
 **onRoutingResultDispatched**: Automation will happen when a routing is dispatched. 
 **onStartTrip**: Automation will happen when a start trip is triggered. 
 **onFinishTrip**: Automation will happen when a finish trip is triggered. 
**Example:** `onTaskFinished`

dataType.description:
Automation's data type. There are 4 different types. 
 *enum: task, data, routingResult, locationHistory* 
 **Default:** `task`

isActive.description:
Automation's active state, only active automation will proceed by system
**Default:** `true`

automationType.description:
Automation's type. The changes you want to automate. There are 6 different types: 
  *enum: createTask, createAssignTask, moveTask, assignTask, webhook, createOrUpdateDataSource, notification* 
 **createTask**: The task will create when an event happens. 
**Example**: `createTask`

automationDetails.description: Set of fields according to the selected automation type. Each automationType have different automationDetails.

flow.description:
Type of task that will be created when an event happens. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createTask** and **createAssignTask** 
 **Example:** `Delivery`

flowId.description:
The Identifier of organization's flow. It required with flow param. Use [Flow /flows API](#tag/Flow) to get the list of flow ids.
**Example:** `67be687c128306111e022022`

taskData.description:
The task will be created with the given data (different flow may have different sets of field). Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createTask** and **createAssignTask** 
**Example:** 
`{`
`'customerName'`:`'vasco'`,
`'address'`:`'Jakarta'`,
`'description'`:`'$refFlow.name'`
`}`
The value can be set as static value such as: `'Jakarta'`.
or set as dynamic value according to `rules.flow` such as : `'$refFlow.name'`

hubId.description:
Unique ID to identify a hub. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **moveTask**,**createAssignTask** and **createTask** if using *event* is **onDataSourceCreated** with data type is common hub. To use a dynamic hub, you can utilize the hubId with the value `$refFlow.hubId` in the **createAssignTask** type. 
 **Example:** `634e98498ce07d29474a7e29`

assignee.description:
List of username that has been assigned the task. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **assignTask** and **createAssignTask** 
 **Example:** `['roberto@mile.app']`

reassignment.description:
Type of reassigment that will be auto assign when user created task. Field only exist, if *event* is **onTaskFinished** or **onTaskCreated** and *automationType* is **createAssignTask**. 
 There are 3 types of *reassigment* if *event* is **onTaskFinished** :`assignee`,`assignedBy`,`doneBy`. 
 and there are 2 type of *reassigment* if *event* is **onTaskCreated** :`assignee`,`assignedBy`.  
 **Example:** `assignee`

url.description:
Reference link for using webhooks. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **webhook** 
 **Example:** `https://apiweb.mile.app/webhook`

headers.description:
The key and value will be sent using a webhook. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **webhook** 
 **Example:** `{` 
 `'x-api-key': '1234e98498ce07d29474a7ev2',` 
 `'org': 'general'` 
`}`

dataTypeId.description:
The identifier of data type. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** 
 **Example:** `644fcd63562387038543fce2`

dataId.description:
The identifier of data source. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** 
 **Example:** Value can be set as dynamic values according to the data source that has been mapped with the flow such as : `$refFlow.pickupNumber`

dataSource.description:
The data source will be created or updated with the given data (different data type id may have different sets of field). Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource**
**Example:** 
`{`
`'customerName'`:`'vasco'`,
`'address'`:`'Jakarta'`,
`'contact'`:`'$refFlow.phoneNumber'`
`}`
The value can be set as static value such as: `'Jakarta'`.
or set as dynamic value according to `rules.flow` such as : `'$refFlow.phoneNumber'`

updateLimitUser.description:
Configuration to run automation using user limit. If `updateLimitUser` has a value of true, users can execute automation using either 'limitUser' or 'limitType'. And if `updateLimitUser` has a value of false, the automation will run without using a user limit.Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource**..
**Example:** `false`

replaceLimitUser.description:
Configuration to replace the current existing user limit. If `replaceLimitUser` is set to `true`, users can execute automation using either `limitUser` or `limitType`, replacing the existing user limit. If `replaceLimitUser` is set to `false`, the automation will run without modifying the existing user limit. This field only exists if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource**.
 Note: `updateLimitUser` and `replaceLimitUser` cannot both be set to `true` at the same time.
**Example:** `false`

limitUser.description:
Data source automation will be created using user restrictions based on user emails in the same organization or can be empty if the data source can be accessed by all users. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** and *updateLimitUser* or *replaceLimitUser* is **true**.
**Example:** `['john@gmail.com']`

limitType.description:
Data source automation will be created using user restrictions determined based **assignee**, **assignedBy** and **doneBy** when completing a task. Field only exist, if *automationType* is **createOrUpdateDataSource** and *updateLimitUser* or *replaceLimitUser* is **true**.
**Example:** `assignee`

channel.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification**
The notification provider using fonnte as third party service.
 The value must be : whatsapp.
**Example:** `whatsapp`

taskFieldReceiver.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification** and chanel selected is whatsapp
Reference of task component for get the receiver phone. This Field must be from initial page and component type must be Phone Number.
 **Example:** `customerPhone`

secretKey.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification** and chanel selected is whatsapp
The api key that provided by fonnte after registered an account and link a device as sender phone number.
**Example:** `wWbN#T!_UTATzFRXrd@X`

message.description:
Field only exist, if *automationType* is **notification** and chanel selected is whatsapp
Dynamic text that supports the inclusion of variables, It can contain static text and specified variable using `{` and `}` that will be replaced with actual values when the message is sent.
 Supported Variable : organization_name, link 
 *organization_name: Account Organization Name*. 
 *link: Task tracking link*.
**Example:** `Greeting, we are from {organization_name} and will be delivering to your location. Track your delivery here {link}. Thank you`

rules.description: Act as an automation's criteria. Criteria that must be true to run an Automation.

Filter automation by flow. When a task is created/assigned/finished with a specific flow, then the automation will take place.
**Example:** `Pickup`

**Example:** `67be687c128306111e022022`

**Example:** 
`{`

`'address'`:`'kemayoran'`
`}`

event.description:
Act as a trigger that start an automation. There are 8 different types. 
 *enum: onTaskCreated, onTaskFinished, onTaskAssigned, onDataSourceCreated, onRoutingResultFinished, onRoutingResultDispatched, onStartTrip, onFinishTrip* 
 **onTaskCreated**: Automation will happen when a task is created. 
 **onTaskFinished**: Automation will happen when a task is finished (status task: Done). 
 **onTaskAssigned**: Automation will happen when a task is assigned to field user(s). 
 **onDataSourceCreated**: Automation will happen when a data source is created. 
 **onRoutingResultFinished**: Automation will happen when a routing created is created. 
 **onRoutingResultDispatched**: Automation will happen when a routing is dispatched. 
 **onStartTrip**: Automation will happen when a start trip is triggered. 
 **onFinishTrip**: Automation will happen when a finish trip is triggered. 
**Example:** `onTaskFinished`

ImportMonitoringObject.title: ImportMonitoringObject
ImportMonitoringObject.description: Complete import monitoring record with all fields from the ImportMonitoring model

_id.description:
Unique identifier for the import monitoring record generated by system.
**Example:** `65f8a4c2d9e3b1234567890a`

organizationId.description:
Organization ID that owns this import.
**Example:** `63c61d865347e356d05e3052`

inputType.description: The input type of the component (e.g., string, number, date, etc.)

hubId.description:
Hub ID associated with this import (if applicable).
**Example:** `63c63ab1b6972d3150348172`

filename.description:
Original filename of the uploaded file.
**Example:** `outlets_import.xlsx`

totalRows.description:
Total number of rows in the imported file (excluding header).
**Example:** `150`

totalValid.description:
Total number of valid rows successfully imported.
**Example:** `145`

totalInvalid.description:
Total number of invalid rows that failed validation or import.
**Example:** `5`

status.description:
Current status of the import process.
- `onprocess`: Import is currently being processed
- `success`: All rows imported successfully
- `partially`: Some rows succeeded, some failed
- `failed`: Import completely failed
**enum:** `onprocess`, `success`, `partially`, `failed`
**Example:** `partially`

fileTemplate.description:
URL to download the template file for this import type. Template is generated based on data type schema or flow configuration.
**Example:** `https://staticdev.mile.app/dev-mile/templates/template_OutletDetail.xlsx`

fileFailedImported.description:
URL to download file containing failed records. Only available when status is 'partially' or 'failed' and there are invalid rows. File includes error messages for each failed row.
**Example:** `https://staticdev.mile.app/dev-mile/failed/failed_outlets_import_65f8a4c2d9e3b1234567890a.xlsx`

**Example:** `63d8c9b0dbd5ef20a627dd86`

**Example:** `Delivery`

**Example:** `64a5c8d2e9f1b2345678901c`

visitTypeName.description:

**Example:** `Customer Visit`

routeConfigId.description:

**Example:** `65b6d9e3f0a2c3456789012d`

routeConfigName.description:

errorMessage.description:

**Example:** `File validation failed: Invalid data type ID`

processedAt.description:
Timestamp when the import processing was completed. Format: Y-m-d H:i:s
**Example:** `2024-03-18 10:32:15`

processingDuration.description:
Duration of import processing in seconds. Calculated as difference between processedAt and createdTime.
**Example:** `90`

totalChunks.description:
Total number of chunks the file was divided into for processing. Large files are processed in chunks for better performance.
**Example:** `3`

processedChunks.description:
Number of chunks that have been processed. Use this with totalChunks to calculate processing progress.
**Example:** `3`

createdBy.description:
Email of the user who initiated the import.
**Example:** `john.doe@mile.app`

updatedBy.description:
Email of the user/system that last updated this record. Usually 'system' for background processing updates.
**Example:** `system`

createdTime.description:
Timestamp when the import was created. Format: Y-m-d H:i:s
**Example:** `2024-03-18 10:30:45`

updatedTime.description:
Timestamp when the record was last updated. Format: Y-m-d H:i:s
**Example:** `2024-03-18 10:32:15`

The organization's configuration determines whether file access permissions are `private` or `public`. If access permissions are set to private, files can only be accessed by users with access to the Mileapp application and can only be viewed through the Mileapp application. If access permissions are set to public, files can be accessed by everyone and viewed on any device. The default value of this file access permission is `private`.
**Example:** `public`

VehicleRouteInternal.description: Internal vehicle route object with comprehensive routing and operational details

_id.description: An unique identifier for the vehicle record, often used for database or system reference.

name.description: The name of vehicle. User can define vehicle name with vehicle's license plate, vehicle brand, or something else.

assignee.description: Users's email that assigned to the vehicle. One vehicle can only be assigned by one worker.

speed.description: Assume the average speed (in km/h) of the vehicle.Speed cannot be less than 5 km/h.

fixedCost.description: The Cost Factor value range is set from 0 to 100, with the default value being 0. A lower number signifies a higher priority for routing optimization purposes.

tags.description: The tag is used for route optimization purposes. Visits that have tags will be assigned to vehicles that have the same tags.

oddEven.description: Odd-even license plate restriction category for this vehicle. Used to enforce odd-even traffic restrictions during specified time windows. Accepted values are 'odd' for odd-numbered plates or 'even' for even-numbered plates.

workingTime.description: Working hours on vehicles containing: **startTime**, **endTime**, and **multiday**.

startTime.description: Time of departure of the vehicle from the hub.

endTime.description: Maximum working time of vehicle to operate.

multiday.description:
Additional working days accumulatedbased on the number of days.
Implementation of **multiday** is used to add **endTime** value,
which means **endTime** = **endTime** + (24 hours * **multiday**)

breakTime.description: Indicates that the data inside represents the break time for the vehicle. containing: **startTime**, and **endTime**.

startTime.description: This field specifies the starting time of the break.

endTime.description: This field specifies the ending time of the break.

capacity.description: Capacity is used for route optimization purposes, it's dynamic based on user needs. It has minimum and maximum value as the limit for the shelter that can be accommodated by the vehicle.

hubs.description: Indicates that the data inside represents the break time for the vehicle. containing: **startTime**, and **endTime**.

_id.description: An unique identifier for the hub record, often used for database or system reference.

name.description: The name of vehicle hub. User can define hub name with hub's location, or something else.

hubId.description: Identifier for the hub that owns or manages the vehicle.

organizationId.description: Identifier for the organization or company that owns or manages the vehicle.

updatedTime.description: Timestamp represents the last time the vehicle data was updated. It includes date and time information.

createdTime.description: Timestamp represents the date and time when this vehicle data was initially created.

failedCode.description:
Route Module business failedCode that indicate specific failure conditions or business rule violations during route module operations. These codes help identify the failed operation of route-related and provide standardized failure identification across the system.

Possible values:
- route-031: Duplicate entry - Route identifier already exists
- route-032: Invalid state/condition - Route state transition invalid
- route-033: Route not found - Route record does not exist
- route-035: Access forbidden - User lacks routing permission
- route-038: Service unavailable - Routing service down
- route-040: Limit exceeded - Route limit exceeded
- route-041: External service error - Map/geocoding service failure
- route-043: License/subscription error - Routing feature not in license
- route-045: Server error - Internal server failure in routing

status.description:
Indicates the current status of the user account within an organization. Accepted values are: 

 
                          `active` : The account is currently active and the user can perform actions based on their role.
 
                          `inactive` : The user has registered a new organization but has not completed email verification. 
 
                          `pending` : The user has been invited to this organization but has not yet accepted the invitation. 
 
                          `disabled` : The account has been deactivated by the organization and cannot be used. 
 
                          `reject` : The user has either accepted an invitation from another organization or created a new organization, causing all other pending invitations to be automatically rejected.
